Qualifiers.Scope: Maximum building height for main dwelling units on standard lots
Applicability: Applies to main dwelling (primary residence) located on a standard lot
Height measured to the roof peak and specifically to the top of roof material per Figure 42
Exclusions: Does not apply to substandard or flag lots
Does not apply to accessory structures or 2nd-dwelling units
AmbiguityNotes: The term 'standard lot' is not defined on this page; rely on external code definitions.
Measurement point is described both as 'to roof peak' and 'to top of roof material'; assumed to mean the topmost point of the roofing material at the peak.
Figure 42 roof slope labels (e.g., '12:14') appear inconsistent with the stated rise:run convention; use the textual rule for compliance.

roof_slope_rise_in_per_12in_run.description: Vertical rise in inches for every 12 inches of horizontal run (rise:12).

height_to_roof_peak.description: Vertical distance from grade to the highest point of roofing material at the roof peak.

roof_slope_threshold_rise_per_12in_run.description: Equivalent to a slope ratio of 12:12 (rise:run).

Constants.measurement_reference: Height measured to top of roof material (Figure 42)
Constants.roof_slope_definition: Roof slope is the vertical rise in inches for every horizontal distance of twelve inches (the run). Expressed as rise:run (e.g., 6:12).

Conditions.logic: IF structure_type == 'main_dwelling' AND lot_type == 'standard' AND roof_slope_rise_in_per_12in_run < 12 THEN height_to_roof_peak <= 30 ft

MutualExclusivity: Mutually exclusive with R2 for standard lots (slope threshold split).
Mutually exclusive with R3 (different lot type) and with R4/R5 (different structure types).

Figures.note: Height measured to top of roof material; comparison of roof slopes.
Determining slope of roof; slope expressed as rise:run over a 12-inch run.

Dependencies: Depends on correct determination of roof slope per Figure 43.

Qualifiers.Scope: Maximum building height for main dwelling units on standard lots
Applicability: Applies to main dwelling (primary residence) located on a standard lot
Roof slope must be greater than or equal to 12:12 (rise:run)
Height measured to the roof peak and specifically to the top of roof material per Figure 42
Exclusions: Does not apply to substandard or flag lots
Does not apply to accessory structures or 2nd-dwelling units
AmbiguityNotes: The term 'standard lot' is not defined on this page; rely on external code definitions.
Measurement point phrasing differs between 'roof peak' and 'top of roof material'; assumed equivalent at the peak.
Figure 42 labels appear inconsistent with the rise:run convention; use the textual rule (≥12:12) for compliance.

roof_slope_rise_in_per_12in_run.description: Vertical rise in inches for every 12 inches of horizontal run (rise:12).

height_to_roof_peak.description: Vertical distance from grade to the highest point of roofing material at the roof peak.

Constants.measurement_reference: Height measured to top of roof material (Figure 42)
Constants.roof_slope_definition: Roof slope is the vertical rise in inches for every horizontal distance of twelve inches (the run). Expressed as rise:run (e.g., 6:12).

Conditions.logic: IF structure_type == 'main_dwelling' AND lot_type == 'standard' AND roof_slope_rise_in_per_12in_run >= 12 THEN height_to_roof_peak <= 33 ft

MutualExclusivity: Mutually exclusive with R1 for standard lots (slope threshold split).
Mutually exclusive with R3 (different lot type) and with R4/R5 (different structure types).

Figures.note: Height measured to top of roof material; comparison of roof slopes.
Determining slope of roof; slope expressed as rise:run over a 12-inch run.

Dependencies: Depends on correct determination of roof slope per Figure 43.

Qualifiers.Scope: Maximum building height for main dwelling units on substandard or flag lots
Applicability: Applies to main dwelling (primary residence) on substandard lots or flag lots
Height measured to the roof peak and specifically to the top of roof material per Figure 42
Exclusions: Does not apply to standard lots
Does not apply to accessory structures or 2nd-dwelling units
AmbiguityNotes: Definitions of 'substandard lot' and 'flag lot' are not provided on this page; rely on external code definitions.
No slope-based differentiation is provided for substandard/flag lots; assumed to be a flat cap regardless of roof slope.
Measurement point phrasing differs between 'roof peak' and 'top of roof material'; assumed equivalent at the peak.

height_to_roof_peak.description: Vertical distance from grade to the highest point of roofing material at the roof peak.

Constants.measurement_reference: Height measured to top of roof material (Figure 42)

Conditions.logic: IF structure_type == 'main_dwelling' AND lot_type IN ['substandard','flag'] THEN height_to_roof_peak <= 17 ft

MutualExclusivity: Mutually exclusive with R1 and R2 (which only apply to standard lots).
Mutually exclusive with R4 (accessory structures) and R5 (2nd-dwelling units).

Figures.note: Height measured to top of roof material.

Qualifiers.Scope: Maximum building height for accessory structures located in rear or side yards
Applicability: Applies to accessory structures located in the rear yard or side yard
Height measured to the roof peak and specifically to the top of roof material per Figure 42
Exclusions: Does not apply to accessory structures located in other yard areas (e.g., front yard) unless specified elsewhere
Does not apply to main dwellings or 2nd-dwelling units
AmbiguityNotes: What qualifies as an 'accessory structure' is not defined on this page; rely on external code definitions.
Location constraint is explicit (rear or side yard); height rules for other locations are not provided here.
Measurement point phrasing differs between 'roof peak' and 'top of roof material'; assumed equivalent at the peak.

yard_location.description: Location of the accessory structure on the lot.

height_to_roof_peak.description: Vertical distance from grade to the highest point of roofing material at the roof peak.

Constants.measurement_reference: Height measured to top of roof material (Figure 42)

Conditions.logic: IF structure_type == 'accessory_structure' AND yard_location IN ['rear','side'] THEN height_to_roof_peak <= 12 ft

MutualExclusivity: Mutually exclusive with R1/R2/R3 (main dwellings) and R5 (2nd-dwelling units).

Figures.note: Height measured to top of roof material.

Applicability: Applies to second-dwelling units (often referred to as ADUs/accessory dwelling units, if so defined in code)
Height measured to the roof peak and specifically to the top of roof material per Figure 42
Exclusions: Does not apply to main dwellings or non-dwelling accessory structures
AmbiguityNotes: The term '2nd-dwelling units' is not explicitly defined here; confirm whether this equals ADUs per local code.
Measurement point phrasing differs between 'roof peak' and 'top of roof material'; assumed equivalent at the peak.
Lot type (standard vs substandard/flag) is not specified; assumed to apply to all lots unless otherwise limited by code.

height_to_roof_peak.description: Vertical distance from grade to the highest point of roofing material at the roof peak.

Constants.measurement_reference: Height measured to top of roof material (Figure 42)

Conditions.logic: IF structure_type IN ['second_dwelling_unit','ADU'] THEN height_to_roof_peak <= 17 ft

MutualExclusivity: Mutually exclusive with R1/R2/R3 (main dwellings) and R4 (accessory non-dwelling structures).

Figures.note: Height measured to top of roof material.
